conclusion: Determine the total Ampere force on the wire frame given the force on the straight part.

The wire frame consists of a straight part between points M and N and a semi-circular part with radius r connecting points M and N. The frame is in a uniform magnetic field perpendicular to the magnetic field.
The force on the straight part is given by F = I (2r) B.
The effective length of the semi-circular part is L_arc = πr.
The force on the semi-circular part is F_arc = I (πr) B.
The total force is the sum of the forces on the straight and semi-circular parts: F_total = F_straight + F_arc.
Substitute expressions for F_straight and F_arc: F_total = I (2r) B + I (πr) B = I r B (2 + π).
Given F = I (2r) B, substitute into F_total: F_total = F + I (πr) B.
The magnitude of the Ampere force on the entire wire frame is F_total = F (1 + π/2).
